reviews.sentence: Phoenix. Byron at front desk and Concierge GiGi were very welcoming and friendly. Brady Lamar was very helpful and considerate in a situation that came up. He also helped with printing our boarding pass to return home. The hotel is close to Chase field. We walked there and back to watch the SF Giants play. It is across the street from several restaurants and a small park. The location was good but had to rent a car to see some of the sights. Hole in the rock is a car ride away. Easy to moderate hike but worth it. Vanessa the other concierge was not very friendly. She made us feel like we were bothering her when asked for her help.

Excellent Service Hotel. Great place to stay overnight prior to our flight home to Ohio. There is a Arizona Plaza right next door where the Mr and I spent the evening sampling the happy hour drinks and appetizers. too much to have in one night.

Christmas eve dinner. Great as usual. Excellent calamari chicken fried steak with taso gravy salmon and braised short ribs. Staff and service were terrific. General manager on restaurant manager. I think even made our daughter a dog balloon animal. Of course the Christmas train and decorations were all she cared about.
Smack downtown three blocks away from the convention centre. The staff is super friendly and the full length pool is great to get a few laps in at lunch time.
Wonderful. extra comfy bed and pillows great location staff was wonderful loved the polParking cost could have been less and there were a few bums around the area at night.

Home away from home. I stayed at this hotel for a week and appreciated the quality of service the prime location and the hotel amenities. Staff was friendly and helpful and plentiful Even when there was a line at check in the line moved quickly and the staff was efficient and thorough with questions I had and any help I needed. The rooms were spacious and clean. I felt like I was a valued customer and was treated with courtesy and a smile by the housekeeping staff and the front desk. The location of this hotel is ideal for activities in the area and it is close to shopping and restaurants.
Everything about our stay at the Sheraton Grand phoenix was phonomenal. Lovely buffet environment and service. Our stay was too short.

Wonderful staff. I was there for a conference of 350 people. I have food restrictions. The staff especially Pam Perry helped me enjoy the amazing food without any dietary conflicts. The food was great and the staff were great.

Good service and great location. Stayed here for four days and was pleasantly surprised by the service and quality of rooms. Bright fresh showers. Excellent housekeeping services. Great and friendly waitstaf in restaurants. Centrally located in Phoenix. Easy to get around. Best location for proximity to convention centre. Would stay here again.

Loved my stay at the Sheraton. Lovely hotel nice rooms beautiful city views especially at night great pool. The staff especially the kind concierge Byron helped to make my stay comfortable and special.

Construction Woes But Do n’t Miss the Art. After the construction is done guests staying at the hotel may miss the art glass installation by the elevator between the first and second floor. Do n’t miss it. In fact it is worth stopping by just to see it. It is by Deane Sabeck. I only wish more information were provided about the instalationFor now things are disrupted. They have lots of work arounds for stuff and try to have staff stationed around to help way find. But it remains inconvenient. The elevator service is limited. Breakfast was comical with electrical circuits being overloaded and napkins running out in the lounge. What was scary was a guest commented how much BETTER organized than the previous day. The room was small for two double beds. Why only one robe with 2 beds. Take the eco version of housekeeping. WiFi was good. The TV was huge. Intuitive shower controls. The staff were outstanding and friendly but just not pleasant right now. The noise stops at night but it ’s loud during the day.

xtreme disappointment. Hotel not under construction but heavy remodeling. Our room was newly remodeled and reasonably comfortable but by no means luxurious or anything. No breakfast available at 1045 am. Neither bar was open. We had to go to a Hooters avros the street for a quick drink bite. UGH. Total fail in terms of service and value for money. And this is how they treat their rewards customers.

Not the newest rooms but they are renovating. Still my room was big spotless and truly comfortable. The staff were amazing. Three of my work colleagues booked too late after the Sheraton sold out and wound up booking at the San Carlos. That property was not habitable so the Sheraton staff allowed myself and another coworker to add two extra guests to our rooms. It was last minute so I asked for a cot that I could setup for them. Before I knew it housekeeping was at the door and set everything up for us. Plus they brought extra toiletries without us even asking. Recieving such service especially with the hotel packed makes me want to always book Sheraton Mariot.

Hotel room was clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. Location was very convenient. The hotel was under construction while I was there but what was missing due to construction was made up for by the hotel staffs helpfulness.

Excellent All The Way Around. The Sheraton name already comes prequalified. This location certainly lived up to what that name has come to be known for. I could write 10 words but the summary is simply stay here. You will not be disappointed. Now this review would not nearly be complete if I did not mention an all star staff member of this property Mr Byron Mariow. Mr Marlow is the Lead Concierge and it is absolute no surpirse that he is the LEAD. This gentleman could easily have the title Customer Service Ambassador. His level of customer service is something on the order of Exemplary times 100. If would be worth a visit to this property to just have the experience of what I am attempting to communicate here. I enjoyed this property for sure but it is Mr. Byron Marlows customer service that compelled me to pen this review. Mr Byron Marlow your service rating on a scale of 1 to 10 with 10 being the best is a perfect 20.

Very Disaponted thought I picked the Best. Well I am so disaponted in the Sheraton. Back in December i made arrangements to give my daughter and her husband a special birthday weekend and I did it early so it would be wonderful. But I guess I picked out the wrong hotel. You advertised how wonderful it was but FAILED miserably. I got them tickets for Cirque du soleil and paid for a parking ticket since your front desk said their were no shuttles to take them really they were lined up 10 deep. Then they got to room nice room even though I asked for the king they had doubles but front desk did catch that and they got King. They picked up phone for room service and no phone after they asked for my daughters credit card. She went down to front desk waited half hour and still no phone she went down again because can not call front desk with no phone working. Again was told it would be taken care of. They went to show came back no phone still and now its cold and heater does not work either. Had to go DOWN to front desk again and front desk allowed them to use a phone for room service which did not come for hour and 11 at night. Maintenance man came could not fix phone or heater. Said he would be back never showed up again. My daughter was getting over end of flu had to sleep in coat. Oh front desk said they would comp food however. never saying sorry. and when they went to leave they charged my daughter card for parking 260 so they made their money on food. and I would have paid had I known.

Most uncomfortable “ upgrade ” ever. They claim this hotel was just renovated but it is like a barracks furniture bolted to the walls very uncomfortable furniture off gassing leaves a chemical odor from the faux wood floors no closet doors etc. Has a Motel 6 vibe. It is incomprehensible that a convention hotel catering to us business travelers has no desk in the room only a small table with plugs in the middle so you ca n’t properly lay a laptop flat. Just ugly as hell for the rate of 209 per night. The manager said all Sheraton hotels are being remodeled this way so this will be my last Sheraton stay as a status Bonvoy member. Hotel lobby is also torn up noisy black sheeting all over no real restaurant. Ugh. Avoid it.

Front desk was extremely rude since the first day we arrived no parking no direction on where to park. Room service did not even leave soap shampoo or conditioner in my room second day toilet had yellow pee stain really unacceptable experience will never stay here. No parking at all.

Front desk was extremely rude since the first day we arrived no parking no direction on where to park. Room service did not even leave soap shampoo or conditioner in my room second day toilet had yellow pee stain really unacceptable experience will never stay here. No parking at all.

Poor. room was clean. Poor front desk communication. Checkin was delayed. We flew in a couple hours early and it was 330 by the time they finally found us a room. I emailed a need for a fan and they did n’t get one. Also was a huge convention and at times we could n’t either access the elevator or long lineups.
